extendedIngredients.name: creamy peanut butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ c creamy peanut butter, melted

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods

whole wheat flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ c whole wheat flour (measured correctly)

recipes.title: Cherry Peanut Butter Oatmeal Cookies

winePairing.pairingText: Cookies works really well with Cream Sherry, Madeira, and Prosecco. Sweet bubbly Prosecco doesn't overwhelm simple sugar or shortbread cookies, a sweet cream sherry complements spiced cookies, and madeira's nutty notes match cookies with nuts perfectly. You could try NV Solera Cream Sherry. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: In a medium bowl, whisk together the oats, flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. In a separate bowl, stir together the peanut butter, egg, and vanilla. Stir in the honey until thoroughly incorporated. Add in the flour mixture, stirring just until incorporated. Fold in 3 tablespoons of diced cherries. Chill the dough for at least 30 minutes. (If chilling longer, cover with plastic wrap, ensuring it touches the entire surface of the cookie dough.)Preheat the oven to 325°F, and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a Silpat.Drop the cookie dough into 15 rounded scoops on the baking sheet. (If chilled longer than 1.5 hours, flatten slightly.) Gently press the remaining diced cherries into the tops of the cookie dough. Bake at 325°F for 11-13 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for at least 15 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack.

steps.step: In a medium bowl, whisk together the oats, flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. In a separate bowl, stir together the peanut butter, egg, and vanilla. Stir in the honey until thoroughly incorporated.

Add in the flour mixture, stirring just until incorporated. Fold in 3 tablespoons of diced cherries. Chill the dough for at least 30 minutes. (If chilling longer, cover with plastic wrap, ensuring it touches the entire surface of the cookie dough.)Preheat the oven to 325°F, and line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a Silpat.Drop the cookie dough into 15 rounded scoops on the baking sheet. (If chilled longer than 1.5 hours, flatten slightly.) Gently press the remaining diced cherries into the tops of the cookie dough.
Bake at 325°F for 11-13 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet for at least 15 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack.
